trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with New Relic | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with New Relic | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use New Relic with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use New Relic with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with New Relic
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with New Relic

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and New Relic.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show how to set up single sign-on between Azure Active Directory and New Relic.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A New Relic single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A New Relic single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to New Relic will be able to single sign-on using the AAD Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure Active Directory users you have assigned to New Relic will be able to single sign-on using the AAD Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for New Relic
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for New Relic

trans-unit.source: Configuring Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for New Relic
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for New Relic

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for New Relic.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for New Relic.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for New Relic, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for New Relic, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type New Relic.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type New Relic.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select New Relic, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select New Relic, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Relic</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Relic</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configuring Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to New Relic with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: This section outlines how to enable users to authenticate to New Relic with their account in Azure Active Directory, using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the New Relic application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the New Relic application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to New Relic page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to New Relic page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the New Relic Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your New Relic application, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the New Relic Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your New Relic application, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: The app URL is your New Relic tenant URL (e.g.: https://rpm.newrelic.com):
trans-unit.target: The app URL is your New Relic tenant URL (e.g.: https://rpm.newrelic.com):

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally to your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, sign on to your New Relic company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, sign on to your New Relic company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Account Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Account Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Security and authentication tab, and then click the Single sign on tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Security and authentication tab, and then click the Single sign on tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the SAML dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Choose File to upload your downloaded Azure Active Directory certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose File to upload your downloaded Azure Active Directory certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Remote login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout landing URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at New Relic page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout landing URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save my changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save my changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure Active Directory users to log into New Relic, they must be provisioned into New Relic.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure Active Directory users to log into New Relic, they must be provisioned into New Relic.

trans-unit.source: In the case of New Relic, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of New Relic, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To provision a user account to New Relic, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To provision a user account to New Relic, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your New Relic company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your New Relic company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Account Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Account Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Account pane on the left side, click Summary, and then click Add user.
trans-unit.target: In the Account pane on the left side, click Summary, and then click Add user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Active users dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Active users dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: As Role select User.
trans-unit.target: As Role select User.

trans-unit.source: Click Add this user.
trans-unit.target: Click Add this user.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other New Relic user account creation tools or APIs provided by New Relic to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other New Relic user account creation tools or APIs provided by New Relic to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to New Relic, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to New Relic, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the New Relic application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the New Relic application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
